news.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: September 2023
news.subtitle: This has been a very busy month! We‚Äôre very excited about the security implications for Snaps, but make sure to check out all the other news this edition has to offer.

Self Custody Education with MetaMask and Ledger


MetaMask Learn in collaboration with Ledger published a lesson in Web3 Security that covers the responsibility of those taking control of their own funds to protect themselves, how to avoid attack vectors, and the importance of using a hardware wallet.

To promote these ideas, MetaMask senior security researcher Miles Nolan joined others from MetaMask and Ledger co-hosted a live X (formerly Twitter) Space on September 20.

MetaMask x Wallet Guard: State of Security


In this quarter‚Äôs joint MetaMask and Wallet Guard X (formerly Twitter) space on the state of security, Wallet Guard regulars Ohm, Martin, and Michael were joined by Marco Menozzi (MetaMask Security) and Christian Montoya (MetaMask Snaps) to talk about device security, social engineering, data breaches, SIM Swapping, scam ads, and MetaMask Snaps (more on that to follow!). Listen to the full recording and/or read the recap.

Did you miss the latest quarterly state of security space with MetaMask & Wallet Guard? üëÄ

From personal security tips to the latest data breaches & an overview of the MetaMask Snaps launch, let's recap what went down! üëá pic.twitter.com/SaEvlYFMYs

— Wallet Guard (@wallet_guard) September 27, 2023

MetaMask Snaps and Security


If you haven‚Äôt already heard, MetaMask launched the open beta of Snaps on September 12 and we‚Äôre very excited about what it means for permissionless, customizable security when using MetaMask. Individual Snaps are features and functionalities created by third-party developers that you can install directly into your wallet. It‚Äôs worth noting that this open beta is targeted towards power users and early adopters, but this is only the beginning. To read more about Snaps, please visit https://metamask.io/snaps/.

While the potential variety of Snaps is vast, several that are security-focused are currently available in the Snaps Directory. Every Snap in the official directory has been audited by our team and external auditing services. In the following thread, Christian Montoya lays out a few basic tips for optimizing your MetaMask security, before going on to list the snaps included in our open beta that can help protect you from risky transactions.

Safety is paramount in web3. Here's a guide to keeping yourself safe in the world of crypto so you can degen responsibly.

üßµ pic.twitter.com/QJI32QpYKe

— Montoya (@MidwitMilhouse) September 25, 2023

üößWhat We‚Äôve Been Working Onüöß


Calldata Allowlist to Mitigate DNS Hijacking Losses


In the past 3 years alone, over $125M has been extracted due to DNS hijacking and malicious content injection. A solution created by the Yearn team that MetaMask is adopting involves creating an onchain calldata AllowList that prevents malicious actors from damaging crypto users in the event of a DNS hijack.

Our developer relations team is now reaching out to third parties whose participation will be vital to the success of this initiative. For more information, please see our public document that links to the POC repo, and this short explainer video featuring Miles Nolan:

LavaMoat Update


  • Improvements to the release process have made releasing trivial. Expect increased release cadence to be the new normal.
  • With an update to how tests are structured, we‚Äôve gotten them to pass in Node 20 and could finally officially cover Node 20 as supported.
  • ScorchWrap plugin is ready for beta. Scheduled to announce the beta at two remote developer events, more to come. The main activity of the beta program will happen here: https://github.com/LavaMoat/LavaMoat/discussions/723
  • Lockdown in MetaMask Mobile is working. Should be released soon.
  • Gal and Zb join the discussion at a W3C event ‚ÄúSecure the Web Forward‚Äù
    • Applying Hardened Javascript to supply chain security for a proactive approach (Zbyszek Tenerowicz)
    • JavaScript realms are used to bypass and eliminate many existing web apps security tools span A problem with a WIP solution (Gal Weizman)

The Same Origin Concern


As part of our efforts to secure same origin realms in web applications by maintaining the Snow JS project, we are also advocating for a browser native solution to achieve better, more secure results. Gal from team LavaMoat, focuses in this document on the ‚Äúsame origin concern,‚Äù describing the lack of control apps have over new realms that rise under their own origin, as well as its implications on their safety, how current efforts to address it fail and what browsers can do to help ship a secure and performant solution for the problem, which was also presented to the W3C security work group this month.

In Other News‚Ä¶


Taylor Monahan weighs in on losses possibly linked SRPs stored in LastPass


A string of high-value thefts totaling around $35 million worth of crypto from security-minded individuals in the tech industry may be linked to a breach disclosed by Last Pass almost a year ago. MetaMask‚Äôs Monahan has been following the clues since December 2022, and was quoted as saying ‚ÄúThe victim profile remains the most striking thing. They truly all are reasonably secure. They are also deeply integrated into this ecosystem, [including] employees of reputable crypto orgs, VCs [venture capitalists], people who built DeFi protocols, deploy contracts, run full nodes.‚Äù

The only major throughline Taylor has been able to find is that these victims used LastPass to store their secret recovery phrases at some point, and her tl;dr moral of the story is: ‚ÄúPLEASE DON‚ÄôT KEEP ALL YOUR ASSETS IN A SINGLE KEY OR SECRET PHRASE FOR YEARS. THE END. Split up your assets. Get a [hardware] wallet. Migrate. Now.‚Äù Read more from Krebs on Security.

Enhancing Blockchain Security with ERC-7512: A Standard for representing smart contract audits onchain


‚ÄúOne of the primary objectives of ERC-7512 is to establish trust within the blockchain ecosystem. Users and dApps can now verify audits conducted by reputable auditors, thus creating an on-chain reputation system for auditors themselves. This standard paves the way for a more secure environment where smart contracts can be relied upon confidently.‚Äù

Rekt Has Gone Phishing


‚ÄúFrom compromised front-ends to ‚Äòpig butchering‚Äô scams, an eight-figure on-chain blunder to hacked celebrities (both crypto and non-crypto), and even government agencies getting duped... the last few weeks have been filled with news of scammers hitting the jackpot via a number of common vectors.‚Äù

This article also covers the high-profile SIM-swap drainer attack on Vitalik Buterin.

For more on Pink Drainer, see this thread from Boring Security

This morning we were putting together a thread on Pink Drainer and their different scam methods.

This afternoon, Vitalik's account was compromised by Pink and several people were scammed using three different techniques.

I guess it's time to we finished that thread.
1/üßµ

— Boring Security (@BoringSecDAO) September 10, 2023

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask is the gateway to the decentralized web, enabling you to do more. Users can connect to any dapp, on any network, from any device. From DeFi to DeSci, gaming to NFTs, and beyond: MetaMask is passionate about the web3 community. Our More With MetaMask Partner Series shines a light on builders who are innovating across the ecosystem. Next up, Banxa.

Navigating crypto used to be a complicated process, but no longer. At Banxa, our mission is to simplify crypto onboarding. As a leading crypto on-ramp and off-ramp solution integrated with MetaMask, we exchange your fiat money for cryptocurrency and vice versa.

Without Banxa, crypto wallets like MetaMask would need numerous integrations, partnerships, and licenses to help their users buy and sell crypto. This process is time-consuming, resource intensive, and involves additional risks and regulatory responsibilities. Banxa handles all of these logistics, so MetaMask can focus on what matters ‚Äì building web3 products that users love.

Configurable crypto journeys

Tailored experiences: MetaMask‚Äôs configurability ensures the best experience for every customer, whether you are a new or returning user.

Streamlined onboarding: For new users, Banxa minimizes the steps needed to buy and sell crypto.

Effortless transactions: Returning users can complete purchases in just one click without leaving MetaMask app, thanks to prior verification.

Worldwide user reach

MetaMask's commitment to accessibility works in tandem with Banxa's vision of global web3 onboarding. Leveraging MetaMask's user-friendly interface and extensive features, Banxa reaches a wider audience, providing an easy gateway to the world of cryptocurrencies. MetaMask‚Äôs configurability also improves our ability to deliver superior experiences to Banxa users.

Powerful web3 APIs

MetaMask provides a robust suite of web3 APIs that serve as a gold standard for product integration. These APIs offer a seamless and standardized approach for Banxa to connect its services with MetaMask, enabling smooth user experiences and efficient transactions.

By integrating Banxa's smooth on-ramp and off-ramp solutions with MetaMask, we've made it easier than ever for users to navigate the decentralized web. The complexity of crypto is no longer a barrier to entry.

Experience the ease of buying crypto with MetaMask via Banxa today.

Looking for more help? We got you. Learn how to buy crypto on MetaMask.

You can now stake ETH, view your staked ETH position, and unstake directly from MetaMask App. (Note: this feature is unavailable for UK users, who will be redirected to MetaMask Portfolio interface.)

Our MetaMask Staking mobile update follows the launch of Pooled Staking earlier this year ‚Äî allowing users to stake any amount of ETH directly with MetaMask, and earn rewards. Additionally, US users will now be able to access MetaMask Pooled Staking in both MetaMask App and in MetaMask Portfolio.

Dive into MetaMask Staking on the MetaMask App now, available for iOS and Android. Need more help? We got you. Check out our MetaMask Support guide to staking.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask is the gateway to the decentralized web, enabling you to do more. Users can connect to any dapp, on any network, from any device. From DeFi to DeSci, gaming to NFTs, and beyond: MetaMask is passionate about the web3 community. Our More With MetaMask Partner Series shines a light on builders who are innovating across the ecosystem.

HyperPlay was founded to build a secure, censorship-resistant, free-market gaming platform. We were, and still are, driven by offering greater flexibility and ownership than the web2 paradigm, while also providing a safer cross-platform experience. Thanks to our efforts, today we are entering a new era of gaming.

Replacing the old formula

While the web2 gaming world continues to cling to its old ways, HyperPlay‚Äôs web3-friendly game store allows players to carry their in-game assets across all games, offering them true ownership and autonomy, without fear of de-platforming. MetaMask wallet is a key integration, eliminating obstacles for gamers and developers alike.

HyperPlay‚Äôs game store brings token swaps, cross-chain bridging, and easy cash to crypto on-ramping into every game through our in-game overlay. This overlay is powered by MetaMask Portfolio, making it secure and easy for gamers to access all of these functions no matter what game they're playing. Wallet transactions take place without leaving a game ‚Äî reducing friction, improving safety, and preserving immersive experiences.

Players can use the same trusted wallet across multiple games and marketplaces instead of traipsing from one platform to the next with a handful of proprietary wallets. Gamers can play their entire existing games library in the HyperPlay app including from other stores like Epic Games and GOG, and combine this library with the games from HyperPlay‚Äôs own official store, all gathered in a single gaming hub.

Our new user experience

By eliminating the need to leave the game to manage assets, HyperPlay‚Äôs MetaMask overlay experience enhances gaming immersion ‚Äî assets can be managed without skipping a beat. Reducing friction in web3 gaming is crucial for encouraging adoption ‚Äî and bringing tokens and in-game collectibles closer to the action increases their utility. Assets that players own should be a joy to use rather than a burden. Streamlining and strengthening the transaction process doesn't just help players, it unlocks new opportunities for developers to innovate and better serve their audiences.

MetaMask Portfolio offers a secure, simple way to explore the web3 gaming universe, featuring HyperPlay's curated list of MetaMask-compatible games, which make it even easier to onboard new players to web3.

Securely powering gamers into the future

HyperPlay‚Äôs MetaMask integration also results in another essential benefit: a safer onboarding experience. The HyperPlay app allows for MetaMask transactions to be visible on-screen without the need to leave or even minimize the gaming experience, all while preserving the privacy of user keys. Secret recovery phrases are never exposed to games, and can even be kept off the gaming computer itself.

For an extra layer of protection, HyperPlay and MetaMask offer users an external signing feature powered by MetaMask Mobile, which keeps keys off the player‚Äôs device. With MetaMask Mobile, gamers can send transactions to an external mobile device, providing a secure connection method that acts as an additional barrier against any potential security compromise.

Combining the innovative tech of HyperPlay‚Äôs game store with the ironclad safety of MetaMask Portfolio‚Äôs in-game overlay is a powerful partnership. Gone are the days where gamers have to hop out of game screens at a critical moment to swap tokens, bridge networks, or buy crypto with fiat. The future of gaming is now.

Leave outdated gaming platforms behind and immerse yourself in web3 gaming by exploring HyperPlay today.
